title: 75/128. Graduation of Vanuatu from the least developed country category
text:
United Nations 
A/RES/75/128
 
 
General Assembly 
Distr.: General 
21 December 2020 
 
20-17075 (E)    231220 
*2017075* 
 
 
Seventy-fifth session 
Agenda item 9 
Report of the Economic and Social Council 
 
 
 
 
 Resolution adopted by the General Assembly 
on 14 December 2020 
 
 
 
 
[without reference to a Main Committee (A/75/L.14/Rev.1 and 
A/75/L.14/Rev.1/Add.1)] 
 
 
 75/128. Graduation of Vanuatu from the least developed country category 
 
 
 
The General Assembly, 
 
Recalling its resolutions 59/209 of 20 December 2004, 67/221 of 21 December 
2012, 68/18 of 4 December 2013 and 70/78 of 9 December 2015,  
 
Reaffirming its commitment to the process of graduation from least developed 
country status and to encouraging smooth transition measures for graduating 
countries beyond graduation and towards achieving sustainable development and the 
2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development,1 
 
Giving due consideration to the destruction caused on the northern islands of 
Vanuatu in early April 2020 by Cyclone Harold, the second category-5 storm to hit 
the country in five years, adding to the immense challenges of rebuilding that Vanuatu 
has been facing, 
 
Noting with concern the negative consequences for the vulnerable small island 
developing economy of Vanuatu due to the closure of its borders, under a state of 
emergency, aimed at keeping the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) at bay, 
 
Inviting the international community to continue to generously support the 
rehabilitation and disaster preparedness efforts undertaken by the Government of 
Vanuatu as well as its recovery plan,  
 
1. 
Commends the commitment of Vanuatu to graduate from the category of 
least developed countries on 4 December 2020, and in this regard welcomes the 
adoption by the Government of the Vanuatu smooth transition strategy; 
__________________ 
 
1 Resolution 70/1. 

A/RES/75/128 
Graduation of Vanuatu from the least developed country category
 
20-17075
2/2 
 
 
2. 
Expresses its deep concern at the severe consequences for Vanuatu of both 
Cyclone Harold in early April 2020 and the closure of its borders due to the 
COVID-19 pandemic; 
 
3. 
Invites bilateral, regional and multilateral development and trading 
partners to provide full support to the implementation of the Vanuatu smooth 
transition strategy, including by extending international support measures, in 
particular those related to trade, as appropriate, aid for trade and participation in 
international forums, until 4 December 2025; 
 
4. 
Underlines the exceptional nature of this decision, taken in the context of 
the unique disruption caused to the economic and social progress of Vanuatu by 
Cyclone Harold and the COVID-19 pandemic. 
 
44th plenary meeting 
14 December 2020

paragraphs.1: Commends the commitment of Vanuatu to graduate from the category of least developed countries on 4 December 2020, and in this regard welcomes the adoption by the Government of the Vanuatu smooth transition strategy; __________________ 1 Resolution 70/1. paragraphs.2: Expresses its deep concern at the severe consequences for Vanuatu of both Cyclone Harold in early April 2020 and the closure of its borders due to the COVID-19 pandemic;
paragraphs.3: Invites bilateral, regional and multilateral development and trading partners to provide full support to the implementation of the Vanuatu smooth transition strategy, including by extending international support measures, in particular those related to trade, as appropriate, aid for trade and participation in international forums, until 4 December 2025;
paragraphs.4: Underlines the exceptional nature of this decision, taken in the context of the unique disruption caused to the economic and social progress of Vanuatu by Cyclone Harold and the COVID-19 pandemic. 44th plenary meeting 14 December 2020
